message.content:
I'll calculate these financial ratios step by step using the provided financial statements.

## Step 1: Calculate Debt to Equity Ratio
Debt to Equity Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Equity

Total Liabilities = $1,903,121.89 (from balance sheet)
Total Equity = $29,250,911.98 (from balance sheet)

Debt to Equity Ratio = $1,903,121.89 / $29,250,911.98 = 0.0651 ≈ 0.07

## Step 2: Calculate Net Profit Margin
Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Revenue) × 100%

Net Profit = $1,250,911.98 (from income statement)
Revenue = $18,062,437.45 (from income statement)

Net Profit Margin = ($1,250,911.98 / $18,062,437.45) × 100% = 6.93%

## Step 3: Calculate Return on Assets (ROA)
ROA = (Net Profit / Total Assets) × 100%

Net Profit = $1,250,911.98 (from income statement)
Total Assets = $31,154,033.87 (from balance sheet)

ROA = ($1,250,911.98 / $31,154,033.87) × 100% = 4.02%

## Step 4: Calculate Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio
Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio = Revenue / Average Accounts Receivable

Revenue = $18,062,437.45 (from income statement)
Beginning Accounts Receivable = $0.00 (from balance sheet)
Ending Accounts Receivable = $10,537,836.59 (from balance sheet)
Average Accounts Receivable = ($0.00 + $10,537,836.59) / 2 = $5,268,918.30

Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio = $18,062,437.45 / $5,268,918.30 = 3.43

{"solution": {'Debt to Equity Ratio': '0.07', 'Net Profit Margin': '6.93%', 'Return on Assets (ROA)': '4.02%', 'Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio': '3.43'}}
